comments.body: This seems fine but if you're just looking for longer delays, randint(5,10) or something?
Maybe i had to add a comment from the original PR .. it has actually a reason for that https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/30277#discussion_r519038459

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +128,132 @@        def context_barrier(x):
            tc = BarrierTaskContext.get()
            time.sleep(random.randint(1, 5) * 2)
            tc.barrier()
            return time.time()

comments.body: Isn't this basically increasing the minimum sleep time? I would think that tend to make it more flaky..
The same question. And, is it different from `random.randint(2, 10)`?

Previously it failed even when the barrior worked some times. All the tasks properly waited for each other and finished properly but it looks like it could still take around a sec when the tests run in parallel.

So I increased the minimum sleep secs and the gap between each task. If barriers don't work, it will take more than 2 secs because the minimum and the gap is 2 seconds. If it works, the gap between each task will take less than 2 seconds.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +125,129 @@        def context_barrier(x):
            tc = BarrierTaskContext.get()
            time.sleep(random.randint(1, 5) * 2)
            tc.barrier()
            return time.time()
